Recap: Reva is almost run down by a drunken and high Gus, but Jonathan pushes her to safety. He takes her to Cedars for a check up after the near miss and finds a bottle of pills for chemo side effects. After he has to yell at her about what they are for, Reva finally admits she has cancer. He is heartbroken. Later, he realizes he is the only one who knows she has cancer. Gus wrecks after driving high and Dinah helps him by letting the police think she was the driver. She tries to get him to get a grip about his addiction. He tells her to go home and he starts to clean his filthy apartment, looking at the pills from afar.

Coop proposes to Lizzie and Ava witnesses the marriage license. Mallet meets with Regina, the woman who came between him and Harley years ago. He realizes the threatening notes came from a man who was after him and not Dinah. Regina hugs Mallet goodbye and Dinah, lurking in the shadows, watches this and is irritated.
Transcript: Reva: No, Jonathan! You can't walk away from this child. You can't because you just never know. Nobody knows. You may not wake up tomorrow! What if this is your last chance?
Jonathan: Fine by me.
Reva: No!
Jonathan: Yes, it is! I'll have other chances.
Reva: Jonathan, please. Please listen to me...
Jonathan: Reva. Would you get off of me? Stop!
Reva: Oh! ( Gasps )
Gus: Whoa.
Reva: Oh! ( Tires screeching )
Jonathan: Reva!
Reva: Oh! Oh!
Jonathan: That's right, don't even stop! You okay?
Reva: Yeah, I'm fine, I'm fine. Thanks.
Jonathan: Whoa, hey. Reva. Come on, what's wrong?
Reva: I'm okay. I am, it's just...
Jonathan: Aw, you scraped your arm.
Reva: No, it's... it's fine.
Jonathan: Come here.
Reva: I'm not hurt, it's okay. Who are you calling?
Jonathan: I'm calling you an ambulance.
Reva: No! No ambulance. Put... hang it up! Please, just hang up the damn phone.
Jonathan: Okay, but then I'm taking you over to Cedars. They'll check you out.
Reva: Just let me sit for a minute and catch my breath.
Jonathan: Come on.
Reva: What?
Jonathan: Come on.
Reva: No, I don't want... I just... please. I don't want to go to the hospital.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Oh, my God.
Coop: Let's make this official. Lizzie, will you marry me?
Lizzie: Yes! ( Laughs ) Yes, yes, yes, I will!
Coop: Look, I... I have this ring, which is kind of special. I picked it out with... with a member of my family. If you don't like it, we can always exchange...
Lizzie: Oh, my gosh! It's perfect! I love it!
Coop: Yeah?
Lizzie: Yeah. ( Laughs )
Coop: Tell you what. Let's head down to the courthouse and get the marriage license.
Lizzie: Okay!
Coop: Yeah?

Lizzie: Yeah! Oh, my God, I'm getting married! ( Laughs ) Do my nails look okay? My hair? I should go home and change. I know we're just getting the license and it's not the wedding or anything, but I should... I should change into something more designer, something more, like, that would go really, really well with the ring!

Mallet: Mallet. Hey, how's it going. Good, you in town now? All right, then let's meet. Ah, yeah. Got it. Okay. Hey, Dinah, sweetie. Uh, listen... why don't you give me a call when you get this, okay? You know what, better yet, why don't you just come home. And I love you. And... one more thing. Don't try to be a hero, okay? Gus can take care of himself.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Gus. Gus, hey! Are you all right? Gus, come on. Wake up. Wake up, Gus, let's go. Wake up. Open the door, open the door. Wake up, let's go. Open the door. Come on!
Gus: How are you doing? Oh, my head... hurts. This building jumped in my way.
Dinah: Honey, you're stoned. You are stoned out of your mind. Aw, man. Come on, I want you to hit the button on your side. Come on. Gus, let's go! Open it up! Open it... ( sirens approach )
Dinah: ( Sighs ) Open the door!
Gus: Hey, what're you doing?
Dinah: I am saving your sorry stoned butt, is what I'm doing.
Gus: Those are mine. You can have one or two of those, but they're the ones that are expensive.
Dinah: Okay, come on. I don't want you to talk anymore, and I want you to get your butt in the passenger seat.
Gus: Whoa, whoa. Okay, all right.
Dinah: Hurry up. Make it fast, and stop talking. Shh.
Gus: Okay.
Nathan: I'm officer Nathan, Springfield P.D. Anybody hurt?

Dinah: No, no. Not at all. I was just being a knucklehead. We... had a little argument and I put my foot too much on the gas, and you know... I don't know. Every time he drinks coffee like this at night, it makes me nuts. He wants to stop by CO2, he wants his coffee, he can't shut up.
Nathan: He needs a fix.
Gus: Yeah, sue me.
Nathan: I haven't been in town long, ma'am, but even I know CO2 is not a drive-thru.
Dinah: Right.
Nathan: May I see your license, please?

Dinah: Oh, yeah. Absolutely, absolutely. Not a problem, I... you know I'm not impaired, in any way. I'm not drunk, or... doing anything funky. I can breathe into one of those things you've got, um... you know, or walk the line, whatever, whatever people do.
Nathan: That won't be necessary, ma'am.
Dinah: Okay. I also could pay for any damages I've done for the city. I apologize.
Nathan: Seems to me that most of your damage is to your car.
Dinah: Yeah...
Gus: That's a shame. Ha, she can walk the walk and talk the talk, though.
Dinah: Okay, no one asked you, sweetie.
Nathan: He looks a little shaky, ma'am. You might want to get him checked out.
Dinah: Yeah, he's shaky, I got a good nutritionist for him.
Nathan: Good.
Dinah: Yeah. Get him in better health. Thank you so much. Sorry about this.
Gus: Ow! Love your work.
Dinah: You owe me!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Regina: God, it is so good to see you again. You... you look better than ever.
Mallet: You too, Regina.
Regina: How many years has it been?
Mallet: Uh, it's been... a long time. I lost track, but, um... you haven't changed at all.
Regina: Yeah, well, I wasn't sure you'd want to see me again. I mean, the woman who came between you and Harley.
Mallet: Yeah, well, the only person that came between me and Harley was... was me. Do you want to, do you want to... let's sit down over here.
Regina: Yeah, yeah.
Mallet: All right.
Regina: Well, so, how is Harley?
Mallet: Uh, Harley is... she's fine.
Regina: Does that mean that...?
Mallet: Uh, no, it's...
Regina: I'm sorry. You know, I ... I really am. And I know that we promised never to contact each other again, but... well, this was important, and I didn't know where else to turn.
Mallet: So anyway. How long have you been receiving these threatening notes?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: I can't believe we're getting married! I am going to be Mrs. Elizabeth Spaulding-Bradshaw. Mrs. Henry Bradshaw!
Coop: Yeah.
Lizzie: Lizzie Spaulding- Bradshaw! Elizabeth Bradshaw. It all sounds good! It sounds good, no matter how you say it. (Laughs )
Coop: I know... I know. Look. I just want everything to be good, all right? Not just for us, though, but for... for our baby, too.
Lizzie: Of course! She's only going to be the most loved, happiest baby in the entire world. I really thought that I was going to have to do this alone. Say hi to your dad, Jenna!
Coop: Little Jenna.
Lizzie: She knows that you're here, I can feel it. She knows her daddy.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Do you have, uh... secondary insurance?
Reva: You know what? Don't worry. I'm not staying.
Jonathan: Reva, what's the big deal? There was a time when you would have killed for me to do the "dutiful son" thing.

Reva: Yeah, well, there was a time I would have killed for you to do the "dutiful daddy" thing too. Because even though you're in denial, it's... it's not that it's not real. Okay, so it was an accident...
Jonathan: We're talking about your accident...
Reva: No, we're talking about you and that little girl you're getting ready to abandon.
Jonathan: I'm not!
Reva: Yes, you are! And you know better! Do the right thing, before it's too late.
Jonathan: Too late?
Reva: Yes.
Jonathan: What's with all the melodrama?
Reva: I'm calling Josh. You just go on. You go on and you make a mess of your own life.
Jonathan: Reva. Come on.
Reva: No, really. Just go. Get out of here. Let some other guy raise your child. I did it, why shouldn't you? Hey, honey, it's me. Josh, don't... don't panic, but I'm at Cedars.
Jonathan: I'm not going back in there. Side effects of chemotherapy?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: I can't believe you live like this. Do you know I've seen kitty litter I'd rather play in?
Gus: I'm not really sure how I hit that wall. I've been meaning to work on the brakes.
Dinah: You know, huh? Do you know how you hit that wall? You were high, Gus. You're still high right now. You are still high!
Gus: Prescription.

Dinah: You know what, bud? I'm going to tell you something. I've been where you are... right now. I've been at the bottom. But I'm going to give you a little news flash right now: I'm not covering for you anymore. Do you hear me?
Gus: What are you talking about, cover for me? It was a little baby fender- bender, that's what...
Dinah: That wasn't a fender- bender. Do you know that you almost hurt yourself? Do you know that you almost hurt somebody else? And what do you think Harley's going say about this?
Gus: ( Groans )
Dinah: The way she reacted when she found out about the pills, what do you think?

Gus: Let me ask you something, have you spoken to Harley? I bet you haven't. But I bet I know who has. Mallet. I bet he's talking to her right now. I bet he's been talking to her every single day since I'm out of the picture. And I bet he's holding her, and caressing her. And I bet it's just a matter of time before they actually hook up. ( Slap )
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Did you check and see if he's still in the prison system?
Regina: Yeah. O'Malley got out a few weeks ago.
Mallet: Ugh.
Regina: God, you remember all the fun he used to have in court watching the D.A. try to prove that he was the one sending those threatening notes to the jurors?
Mallet: And no one could prove a thing. And he beat the murder one charge...
Regina: Yeah, but we got him for manslaughter.
Mallet: Yeah.
Regina: And now...
Mallet: Looks like he's looking for revenge.
Regina: Mm-hmm.
Mallet: Well, you know what? He's not going to get it.
Regina: I wouldn't be so sure about that. I mean, he knows where we work, where we live. He knows where you do your dry cleaning. For all we know, he's watching us now.
Mallet: I'm glad you contacted me. I was thinking those notes were for my fiancée.
Regina: Fiancée?
Mallet: Yeah, you know what, will you excuse me? I should call her and let her know that she's not the one in danger.
Regina: Oh, yeah, of course.
Mallet: Um... would you do me a favor? No one knows that um... well... we haven't told anybody that we're engaged. So I'd appreciate it if...
Regina: Why is it a secret?
Mallet: That's a good question.
Frank: Oh, Mallet, excuse me. What's this? Hm?
Mallet: Uh... I don't know, Frank. Looks like a DVD.
Frank: Oh, you're absolutely right, it is a DVD. It is your episode of "The Law."
Mallet: Oh it is? Really? Great, cool.
Frank: Yeah, yeah, it's a good episode. You know what my favorite part is?
Mallet: What?
Frank: At the end.
Mallet: With the gun, right?
Frank: No, no, actually, when you and Dinah get engaged. Were you ever going to tell anybody about that?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Ava. Hey. What are you doing here?
Ava: Oh, my friend Jerry, he's on duty. So I thought I would stop by and apologize for our last date. You guys are...?
Lizzie: Getting a marriage license. No, I know, I know, I was totally surprised too, but... Coop asked me to marry him, and I said yes.
Ava: Well... congratulations.
Coop: Lizzie, would you give me just a second?
Ava: Ava, look. I'm sorry.
Ava: You know what? You don't have... stop.
Coop: It happened about an hour ago. I asked Lizzie.
Ava: Coop. You are...
Coop: What?
Ava: Next. You're next.
Coop: I... oh, um. Look, just give me a second, okay?
Clerk: I'll need proof that both of you are at least over eighteen. And I'll also need a witness.
Lizzie: A witness?
Clerk: Yeah.
Lizzie: Is that really necessary?
Clerk: It's the law.
Coop: Um... I guess we're just going to have to come back later, Lizzie.
Lizzie: Or...?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Got something you forgot to tell me?
Reva: Why are you still here?
Jonathan: What's up with these?
Reva: Where'd you find these?
Jonathan: They fell out of your bag when we dodged the car. Go ahead, read the label. It says something about the side effects of chemo?
Reva: Well, they're not mine.
Jonathan: Your name is on the label.
Reva: Well, you know, the pharmacy must have made a mistake. You know, they... they got the label wrong.
Jonathan: Yeah, right. Try again.

Reva: You know what, they're... they're... they're antibiotics for the flu. I'm taking a lot of different prescriptions, you know? Vitamins, vitamin B and calcium. You know what I'm going to do, I'm going to go right down there now to that pharmacy and I'm going to straighten it out.
Jonathan: Reva. What the hell is going on?
Reva: Just let go, Jonathan!
Jonathan: What's wrong with you?
Reva: This is nothing for you to worry about.
Jonathan: Mom! Ma!
Reva: Okay, Jonathan! I have cancer, okay? Dammit. I have cancer.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Robert Newman, "Inside The Light." Why do the women in Josh's life go crazy? Uh... I think most of them actually start quite sane, but I think there's something about being in between Josh and Reva that would drive anybody crazy. Well, I think also the fact that Reva continues to return from the dead probably drives most of my ex-wives crazy. See Josh, Wednesday, June 14, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Cancer. How bad?

Reva: Well, it's hard to tell. You know, they've done a bunch of tests, and they're throwing a bunch of numbers at me, but... I guess the numbers aren't getting any better, if that's what you mean, but... don't worry about it, because I'm going to beat this thing.
Jonathan: Yeah. My money's on you.
Reva: Yeah, I know. Thanks. You know, I let you go once before, and I... promised you the... this is just a bump in the road, or in my case, a lump in my breast.
Jonathan: When did, um... this start?
Reva: Oh, it was right after I got back from seeing Marah in Paris.
Jonathan: When you fainted getting off the plane?

Reva: Yeah, can you figure that? I mean, I was on my way out of this place, and I was having a pain in my chest, and... a I thought it was from the seatbelt in that car accident that Billy and I were in, so. The doctor, you know, checked it, and she... she sent me for a mammogram, and then she sent me for another series of tests, and I couldn't even believe it. I mean, I... I really... I thought for sure that Dr. McCabe was going to come in and tell me that he'd made some terrible mistake.
Jonathan: Dr. McCabe? Isn't that the doctor you had look at me?
Reva: Yeah, he's an Oncologist. He's my Oncologist. ( Laughs )
Jonathan: Cancer...?

Reva: Yeah, I didn't want you to know, because I didn't want to see that look on your face, and you're going to have to get rid of that look. Hey... you're going to have to get rid of it. Hey. Don't be afraid for me. Don't, because I'm not afraid.
Jonathan: Is Josh afraid?
Reva: ( Sighs )
Jonathan: What?
Reva: Josh doesn't know.
Jonathan: Who does know? Did you tell Cassie?
Reva: Well...
Jonathan: Did you tell Marah or Shayne? Reva. Who else knows? Me. I'm the only one that knows?
Reva: Yeah. You're the only one.
Jonathan: Dammit! Reva, what the hell is wrong with you?!
[SCENE_BREAK]

Frank: Remember the other day at the station, I asked you, I said "Hey Mallet... you know, is there anything about this show I should know about before it hits the air?" And you said, "No, no, Frank, it's just a typical day. Nothing special."
Mallet: I didn't know they taped the proposal, Frank. We lost them. I didn't see them anywhere.
Frank: Oh, hm. This look familiar to you? Dinah!
Mallet: ( Groans )
Frank: Dinah, will you marry me? Will you be my wife?
Mallet: Frank, stop...
Frank: ( Laughs ) ( high-pitched voice ) Oh, Mallet, yes, yes! I love you so much!
Mallet: Come on, get up, man. That wasn't that bad, was it?
Frank: ( Laughs ) Come on, bud, I'm busting your chops. Congratulations, man!
Mallet: Thanks, thanks.
Frank: Oh, absolutely. You know, I got to tell you, you look good on video. Really. And that kiss? That kiss was so hot, man, you know? You're going to get more fans than "Love in the Lock-up."
Mallet: Oh man...
Frank: Come on, what's the matter with you? Hey! You're engaged, you're getting married.
Mallet: I'm getting married.
Frank: Be excited here.
Mallet: I'm excited.
Frank: I'll tell you what I'm going to do. I'm going to call WSPR. I'm going to find out when the show airs. And we'll throw a big party, and we can all watch it together.
Mallet: No, that's not a good idea. They're not going to air that, are they?
Frank: Why not? Come on, man, it's already out there. There's absolutely nothing you can do about it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dinah: Get a grip. And you leave my fiancée alone, you hear me?
Gus: What did you say?
Dinah: I wasn't going to admit anything, but there you got it. Yes, I'm engaged.
Gus: You're going to marry that schmuck?
Dinah: It smells in here. There's no air. Why don't you open up the doors? What the hell's wrong with your doors, why don't they open?
Gus: They're broken. I got a deal on the room. What did you say?!
Dinah: I'm getting married! I'm getting married, okay? But let's keep perspective, all right? Let's talk about you. Let's talk about your drug problem. Let's talk about your car accident.
Gus: Let's talk about my wife.
Dinah: What are you doing?
Gus: You got a cell phone.
Dinah: No, you're not...
Gus: Bet you her number's in this cell phone.
Dinah: You are not calling Harley.
Gus: I want to talk to her.
Dinah: Gus, give me my phone.
Gus: I want to talk to her.
Dinah: You give me...
Gus: Hold on one sec.
Dinah: Give me!
Gus: I want to talk to her. I think maybe we should... get back... together. But nobody would want to be with someone like me. Like this.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: I can vouch for the two of them. I know both of them.
Coop: No. Ava, look. You don't have to do this.
Ava: It's...
Coop: We'll find some new witnesses, it's okay. Look, Marina's got to be downstairs, or somebody.
Ava: It's fine. I'm here.
Lizzie: Thank you, Ava. I think that this should mark a new era for all of us. No more drama. No more fighting.
Ava: Well, I think I should go. Congratulations again.
Coop: Thank you.
Clerk: All right, well. Here's your license. You're all set.
Coop: Uh... thank you. So, um... are you ready to do this?
Lizzie: I... thought that we just did.
Coop: I mean, get married, Lizzie. Look, the justice of the peace is right down that hall. We can go there, we can grab some coffee or something, and... we can wait for our turn.
Lizzie: Oh... okay.
Coop: What? What is it?
Lizzie: Nothing. Nothing, it doesn't matter.
Coop: Do you want to call your mom, or you grandfather...?
Lizzie: Listen. Okay, I get that you're just marrying me because I'm having your baby. And I get that you probably wish that you weren't such a great guy...
Coop: Lizzie...
Lizzie: Because then you'd get to be with Ava. But this is my wedding. And I don't want it to be some...
Coop: Lizzie!
Lizzie: ...Drive-thru Elvis wedding! I want my family...
Coop: Lizzie! Stop! That's it! Okay, that's enough. Stop.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Jonathan: You are such a hypocrite. You are ragging on me about family, about how I need to claim my baby, when you haven't even told your husband or anyone that you are sick. You give me all this bull about how I keep secrets, about how I'm living in denial. What about you, huh?
Reva: It's just the wrong time. Josh is on the brink of the biggest achievement of his life.
Jonathan: ( Groans )

Reva: He is. A hospital, Jonathan. A community where thousands of people can have better lives. People who are heroes. This was H.B.'s dream. I mean, he could only dream about this. But Josh is making it happen. And I'm not going to stop that, because that's what'd happen. If he knew I was sick, he'd drop the whole thing so he could be with me. So I'm... I'm going to beat this disease so that we can have our life back.
Jonathan: Maybe you just don't want to tell anyone because when you do, then it becomes real.

Reva: What do you want me to do? Huh? You want me to put out a memo? "Hey, I have cancer!" ( Laughs ) You know, this is the happiest part of my life, the happiest time! I've never been happier in my life. But you know what? Cancer doesn't care! So treat me like I'm sick, you know? Give up everything. Give it all up, so that... so that you can hold my hand, so that you can clean up my puke, so that you can help me pick out a couple of wigs. What good could possibly come from that, Jonathan?
Jonathan: Well, then you won't be alone.
Reva: Well, I'm not alone. Not now. I'd kind of like to... get to know that grandchild of mine, too.
Jonathan: ( Sighs ) You are unbelievable.
Reva: I am. You know, I'm right. I am unbelievable, because I'm going to fight this thing like I've never fought anything before in my life.
Jonathan: Hey. If you don't tell Josh, I will.
Reva: Well, hey. I'll make you a deal. You come clean about getting Lizzie pregnant, and I'll come clean about Josh.
Jonathan: That is not the same thing.
Reva: You don't want to hurt Tammy. I don't want to hurt Josh. How is it so different? I'm not telling anyone that I'm sick. And neither are you. ( Sobs )
Jonathan: Here.
Reva: Thanks.
Jonathan: So. Hey. What are you going to do about living with Josh? How are you going to hide the pills and the puking?
Reva: I don't know, I've been doing pretty good so far. You know, because I'm smart. ( Laughs ) And stubborn.
Jonathan: Yeah...
Reva: And I'm pretty sneaky.
Jonathan: And what happens if you fall down again? Like you did today?
Reva: Just pick myself back up again.
Jonathan: Doctors screw up. Did you get a second opinion? Are you sure this is for real?
Reva: More sure than I want to be. ( Crying ) I'm glad you came back.
Jonathan: Hey, your hair.
Reva: Yeah, well, it's the chemo. It's probably all going to come out pretty soon.
Jonathan: This is really happening, huh?
Reva: Yeah, it's really happening.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Dinah: Gus. I've been where you're at. Like I said before. And do you know who pulled me out? Harley. She pulled me out and she helped me just like I'm going to help you, okay? First, we're going to take these pills. We're going to take these pills that I found in the car, and we're going to flush them down the toilet. Okay? We're going to get rid of them.
Gus: That's been tried before. It doesn't work. It has to come from me. When those pills are in front of me, and I can walk away... that's when I've won. Just uh... go home to your fiancée.

Dinah: All right. You feel like a fix, then I want you to do me a favor, and you focus on Harley. Your kids, your future. And you give me a call if you need anything, okay? And I mean anything. I'm still proud of you.
Gus: Don't be, not yet. ( Door shuts ) Don't you stare at me like that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: Hey, Ava. Ava? Hey, what happened?
Ava: Nothing. It's... it's okay, nothing.
Frank: Well, what... is there a customer in there giving you a tough time? Because, you know, you don't need to put up with them, I'll take care of...
Ava: No, Frank, it's not that. Okay? I'm fine.
Frank: Look, I'm going to put my hand up to my face, and if you smile, then, I know that...
Ava: ( Sniffles )
Frank: Ava, what... what's going on? What's wrong?
Ava: It's just... I guess it's, um... the whole engagement thing.
Frank: What, Mallet and Dinah?
Ava: Coop and Lizzie.
Frank: Coop and Lizzie?! They're getting married? What are you talking about? What?!
Ava: They just signed their marriage license.
Frank: Why am I the last person to always find out with this stuff, huh? Oh, Ava, I am so sorry. I am so sorry. I had no idea.
Ava: We had so many plans together, you know? England and... we were really looking forward to getting to know each other more and to spend time together.

Frank: Oh, hey, come here. Come here, um... look, I don't know if this is going to help or not, but... Coop, I mean... I know my brother really cares a lot about you. And I'm sure he's just trying to do the...
Ava: Do the right thing. The right thing, right? Yeah. You know what, sometimes I really wish that he wasn't wired that way.
Frank: Yeah, well... then you wouldn't care about him so much, right?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Now, I am sorry for flipping out on you. All right? But I am constantly feeling like you are pressuring me. Like you're testing me, like getting married isn't enough for you.
Lizzie: Okay. You're right. It is too much to ask for a real wedding. We are getting married for this baby, and... we should go see the judge.

Coop: Stop. Stop, right there. That is exactly what I'm talking about, Lizzie. All right, I'm not doing this just for our baby. I'm doing this for us. You, me, the baby, all three of us. Look, I don't want to live together, to get married just for our baby, to put on a show for her. All right? I want to get married for real. I want to have a real wedding, a real life with you. All right? And I want to have more babies down the road.
Lizzie: Coop, that's what I want, too. That is what I want.
Coop: Well, look...
Lizzie: Let's go get in line.

Coop: No, no, wait. Wait, wait, wait. Your heart is telling you to have a real, traditional wedding. I get that. ( Sighs ) Maybe, maybe we should. I know you're going to want photos to show the kids years from now, and... you know what, maybe that is what we should do. Maybe we should have a traditional wedding.
Lizzie: Really?
Coop: Yes.
Lizzie: Do you mean it?
Coop: Yes, but! There's a but here. Okay?
Lizzie: Okay.
Coop: Nothing crazy, okay? We still have a long way to go before the baby gets here and we have a lot of work to do.
Lizzie: Okay.
Coop: Let's just try and keep it simple, okay?
Lizzie: Okay. ( Laughs )
Coop: Okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Regina: Did you reach your fiancée?
Mallet: Uh, no. I should probably go home, see if she left a note.
Regina: Take this. It's a spare.
